3159.text:
And there would always
be someone behind him

3163.text:
whose job it was to say
to him, remember to die.

3169.text:
So I think that one of the
things a leader really needs

3174.text:
is people who can
say that to him,

3176.text:
trustworthy people
who can say you're not

3179.text: as great as you think you are.

3181.text:
And that's a really
difficult thing to do.

3183.text:
I'd say that each
of these leaders--

3186.text:
the one way in
which they failed is

3187.text:
they all had troubled
relationships with their number

3191.text: None of them had a number two--

3193.text:
none of them had a really good
relationship with a number two.

3196.text:
And often, that
is the thing that

3198.text:
will save leaders-- to have
someone trustworthy who

3202.text: can tell them that very thing.

3204.text:
I think that's one of
the problems they have.

3209.text:
Please join me in
thanking Barry Strauss

3211.text: for being here with us today.

3212.text:
And hopefully, we
can all take away

3214.text:
some interesting food for
thought for the rest of our day
